title: How Tracey Cunningham Colored 17 Stars’ Hair For The Oscars
The Top Hairstyle Trends For 2025
description: When it comes to 2025 beauty, the makeup looks are going to be more experimental, the skin-care trends will be smarter, the top haircuts will be nods to the past, and the hair colors will make you feel like your very best. As for the top hairstyle trends of 2025, you can expect to see a harmony of old and new. It's time to really hone your signature look. This year will be all about taking care of your hair and sharpening your go-to looks, as well as experimenting with new styles and being playful. What that translates to could be anything like fun updos (like braided buns and braided ponytails), old-meets-new looks resurrected from the past (like big, voluminous blowouts), and anything that feels effortless, like boho waves. And before you ask: no, hair accessories aren't going anywhere. Ultra-feminine hair bows, ponytail cuffs, hair scarves, and headbands are popping up everywhere. Keep scrolling for more insight from the pros on the top hair trends 2025 that you need to know about, plus inspiration photos for each one to get you excited to try something new. Experts Featured in This Article Jacob Sirianno is a hairstylist and colorist based in Los Angeles and New York City. Ryan Pearl is a celebrity hairstylist and colorist based between Miami and New York City. He's also the creative director of Tangle Teezer. Brenda Lee Intignano is Cliphair's trends expert.
author: Jessica Harrington

title: Is the Dyson Supersonic-R Hair Dryer Really a Game Changer? I Find Out
description: Anyone who knows me knows that I am a Dyson stan, through and through. I've been obsessed with my Dyson Airwrap ever since I first got it, and it's helped me style my hair in all of my different eras. The short bob, the awkward medium length, and even ultra-long (the style I'm currently trying to get back to). I love my Dyson flat iron (yeah, the one Hailey Bieber uses), and I'm also equally obsessed with my Dyson blow dryer. So, when I heard the brand was coming out with a consumer version of their professional hair dryer, the Dyson Supersonic R, I knew I wanted to test it out. It has different attachments made for all hair types, and its design was created with ergonomics in mind - it's made with an "r" curve that makes it easier to hold. Plus, there are RFID sensors in each attachment that communicate directly with the hair dryer so the motor and heater adjust based on how you're looking to style your hair (like the Nural). Talk about futuristic. Keep scrolling to read my full review of the Dyson Supersonic R Hair Dryer ($570, launching on March 6) and find out if it's worth the hefty price tag. About the Dyson Supersonic R Hair Dryer It comes with five different attachments: a wide tooth comb, an air attachment, a flyaway attachment, a concentrator, and a diffuser. The curved "r" shape makes it easier to hold. The attachments contain RFID sensors to adjust the heat and speed settings. It's made to be used on all hair types. What I Like About the Dyson Supersonic R Hair Dryer I've been using my Dyson Supersonic Hair Dryer for years now - I have a very old version that I bought refurbished back in 2017, and it's been my trusty sidekick ever since. I haven't had any issues with it; however, it is a bit bulky and a little large to travel with. The new Supersonic R is much lighter than the older Supersonic I've been using. The design looks completely different, and to be honest, I was a little taken aback when I tested it for the first time. It almost looks as though you're about to pour water over your head with a garden hose, but it's genuinely so functional and easy to use, I was blown away. (Pun kind of intended.) Already did your arm workout for the day? Don't worry, this is so light you'll barely notice you're holding it. Need to get somewhere quick? The airflow is fast AF and will get the job done in a snap. Plus, the five attachments make styling my hair extremely easy no matter what look I'm going for, from my natural waves to my bouncy blowout. How to Use the Dyson Supersonic R Hair Dryer The Supersonic R is extremely easy to use. It has a power on button, temperature and airflow control settings, and a cold shot button. It comes with five different attachments for all of your styling needs. The concentrator can be used in conjunction with a tool like a round brush to get precise airflow wherever you need it; the air attachment will give you regular air for rough drying; the diffuser is perfect for anyone with curls, waves, or coils; the wide-tooth comb attachment can be used to detangle hair while you dry it; and lastly, there's a flyaway attachment, which can be used to smooth down hair. I typically start off by using the regular air attachment to rough dry, then switch over to the concentrator, which I use with a round brush. From there, I finish things off with the flyaway attachment to make sure my roots are smooth. What to Consider Before Trying the Dyson Supersonic R Hair Dryer One thing to note is that the brand recommends you clean the filter on the blow dryer regularly to maintain your dryer's functionality. I've never cleaned my old dryer's filter, but I'm planning on monthly filter maintenance moving forward because I want this product to last as long as possible. Where the Dyson Supersonic R Hair Dryer Is Available The Dyson Supersonic R Hair Dryer is available directly on the brand's website as of March 7, 2025. Rating: Renee Rodriguez (she/her) is a staff writer and social producer for PS. She writes across all verticals, but her main areas of expertise focus on fashion and beauty content with an emphasis on reviews and editor experiments. She also produces social content for the PS TikTok and Instagram accounts.
author: Renee Rodriguez

title: The Best Haircut Trends From Paris Fashion Week Street Style
description: With Paris Fashion Week in full swing, the best place to find fresh haircut inspiration isn’t just backstage — it’s also among the many stylish guests who descend on the city’s streets ahead of the shows.Paris has mastered a handful of signature cuts — think French bobs, effortlessly perfect fringes, and long, layered styles. This season is no exception. Alongside these timeless looks, we’ve spotted XL braids, pixie cuts, and sharp lobs making a statement.Without further ado, here are 12 of the best haircut trends from Paris Fashion Week so far.All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission.The pixie cut is back with a bang. We love this close-cropped style, complete with a choppy micro fringe. Photo: Christian Vierig/Getty Images.Meet the "snack-size" bob — a sleek, jaw-skimming cut that looks especially chic with a center part.Photo: Christian Vierig/Getty Images.The deep side part and oval layers make this cut — spotted on a guest outside the Marie Adam-Leenaerdt fashion show — utterly chic. Photo: Raimonda Kulikauskiene/Getty Images.This long style, with fragmented full bangs, channels Anne Hathaway in The Devil Wears Prada.Photographed by Christian Vierig/Getty ImagesThis beautiful cut proves that layers and curls are a perfect pair. Photo: Raimonda Kulikauskiene/Getty Images.The slicked-back bun has had its moment; now, the sleek braid takes center stage.Photo: Christian Vierig/Getty Images.We love this grown-out wolf cut, featuring curtain bangs and textured layers through the mid-lengths.Photo: Raimonda Kulikauskiene/Getty Images.Natural hairstyles are reigning at Paris Fashion Week, and these subtle layers elevate this guest’s gorgeous curls.Photo: Christian Vierig/Getty Images.Here’s proof that the medium-length cut is anything but mediocre. Choppy ends, like this guest’s look outside the Ganni show, add extra movement.Photo: by Christian Vierig/Getty Images.Various protective styles, including these beautiful XL braids, have been spotted both on and off the runways throughout fashion month.Photo: Raimonda Kulikauskiene/Getty Images.If your hair is all one length, try C-shape layers like this guest outside the Magda Butrym show. They’ll add dimension and movement.Photo: Ussin Yala/Getty Images.Long layered lengths are taking Paris by storm. This swishy cut is made even more stunning by the mocha mousse hair color.Photo: Ussin Yala/Getty Images.Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?I Got The Kicked Bob & Found My Own Personal StyleThe Best Haircut Trends From London Fashion WeekThe Best Haircuts From NYFW Street Style
author: Jacqueline Kilikita

title: Ilona Maher On Her Game Day Glam & Go-To Sunscreen (It’s Only $10)
description: .disclaimer{width:90%;margin-bottom:1rem}.disclaimer__lines{width:100%;margin:0 auto;border-bottom:1px solid #999;padding:0;max-width:150px}.disclaimer__copy{width:100%;max-width:355px;font-family:Brown Regular,sans-serif;font-size:.9rem;font-weight:300;line-height:1.3em;color:#333;padding:0 0 .4rem;margin:1rem auto;text-align:center} All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. Even through Zoom, Ilona Maher’s presence radiates through my MacBook screen. After all, it’s not every day I get to chat with an Olympian who boasts a massive online following (4.9 million followers on Instagram and 3.5 million on TikTok, and is fresh off an epic run on Dancing With The Stars. If all of that wasn’t enough, Maher is also the newest face — and body — of Coppertone’s Sport sunscreen. Now, if you grew up in the US, chances are you grew up with Coppertone. The iconic sunscreen brand was a staple in my house for its high performance and accessible price point. The Sport range is formulated to withstand sweat, heat, and water, offering broad-spectrum UVA/UVB protection during beach days, vacations, and, you know, crushing it on a rugby pitch.  “If you look in my rugby locker, you’ll see the Coppertone Sport spray,” Maher tells Refinery29. “I have a very cool and different job in that I’m out in the sun sweating and running for three hours a day — and that means a lot of sun exposure.” As we know, sun damage is cumulative and irreversible — but also preventable. Safe practices like daily sunscreen (including reapplication!) are important, and Maher is quick to praise Coppertone’s formulas for their convenience and ease of use. “When I have my jersey and shorts on, I’ll throw it on,” she shares. “You’ll see me a minute before the whistle because we’ve got to get ready to warm up — and I’m applying my Coppertone.” DashDividers_1_500x100 The athlete and activist embodies strength and femininity on and off the field and is open about how important beauty is in her life. “I feel beautiful when I play rugby,” she says. “That’s why I put lipstick on when I play.” (Her go-to is Maybelline SuperStay Matte Ink Liquid Lipstick in Self Starter, $10.99.) On game day, her other getting-ready essentials include Tarte tubing mascara, Maybelline brow gel, and occasionally, a slicked-back pony with hairspray or a gel stick. “[Wearing makeup during games] doesn’t take away from my ability or who I am as a woman,” Maher says. “I love feeling good about myself. I think it makes me a better person and a better player in some ways.” “If people can see that I find myself, and my strong body, beautiful, hopefully they can see it in themselves as well.“Ilona maher Keep reading our latest Power Diaries to see how Maher embodies power and stays strong. DashDividers_1_500x100 I feel most powerful when… I’m lifting weights. Power to me means… Feeling unstoppable. What do you do when you feel powerless? Connect with family and friends. What’s your power anthem?  I like “White Flag” by Joseph. Who is your power icon? The women around me: My teammates, my sisters. What do you wear when you want to feel powerful? I put on lipstick. @ilonamaher INTRODUCING THE NEWEST COPPERTONE GIRL: ME! ☀️ Here’s a sneak peek at what I’ve been up to with @Coppertone USA – stay tuned, I can’t wait for you to see everything we have in store. #UnbeatablePerformance #ad ♬ original sound – Ilona Maher Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?
author: Karina Hoshikawa
